origination.persname: De La Vergne, Earl W., collector.

did.unittitle:
Earl W. De La Vergne collection
1879-1940s
did.abstract: Collector of books, maps, artifacts primarily relating to the Harbor Springs area of Michigan. Artifacts include black ash baskets, porcupine quill and birch bark boxes, and miscellaneous stone and metal implements; and miscellaneous collected material.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Earl W. De La Vergne (donor no. 3152) in 1985.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Earl W. De La Vergne collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Earl W. De La Vergne was a collector of books, maps, manuscripts, and artifacts relating to Harbor Springs and early Michigan history.

scopecontent.p: This finding aid only describes the artifacts and historical documents collected by Earl De La Vergne. The many books he collected have been individually cataloged. The artifacts in the collection include native American black ash baskets and quill boxes, as well as various stone and metal tools and hardware. The collected documents include a diary of an 1879 trip from Kent County, Michigan, to Emmet County, Michigan, by Etta Carpenter [mimeograph of typescript]; 1902 list of birds seen near Harbor Springs, by O. Widmann and Judge Stephenson; notes relating to Michigan history; photographs; and a citation.

did.unittitle: Black ash baskets

note.p: (measurements in inches: length x width x height)

did.unittitle: Black ash sewing basket, yellow, with braided basswood handles
Round black ash waste basket with braided basswood handles
Round black ash waste basket. Top edge trimmed with sweetgrass
Black ash basket with two drop handles (white ash). Vegetable dyes used to color some splints
Black ash marked basket with two drop handles. Sweetgrass trim on top edges. "Checkerboard" design on bottom weaving
Quill boxes
Round, solid quills, natural color with split spruce root edges
Round, solid quill, box with 3 petaled red flower. Broken quills on bottom
Round box with bark exposed on top. Four petal red flower. Many broken quills. In poor condition
Round, solid quill all white background with brown squirrel design. Several broken quills
Round, solid quill, natural quills with a beaver design
Round, plain birch bark box, with stylized flower design. Sweetgrass trim
Round quill box, mostly white solid quillwork with brown bear design. Several broken quills
Round, solid quill natural color, striped pattern. Split root on edges
Oval, solid, all white quill box. Leaf design. Edges trimmed in sweetgrass; Possibly a Laura Parkey box
Round, solid quill box, mostly white color with purple trillium flower
Hexagonal, plain birch bark, open top box
Round quill box, strawberry design
Round quill box, abstract design
Stone Artifacts
1 large ax
3 medium axes
3 medium stones that may be axes, choppers, or scrapers
1 small chopper
2 arrowheads
4 small stones that May be broken arrowheads or scrapers
Metal Artifacts
1 large shovel blade
2 nails
Collected historical materials
Diary of an 1879 trip from Kent County, Michigan, to Emmet County, Michigan, by Etta Carpenter
Llist of birds seen near Harbor Springs, by O. Widmann and Judge Stephenson, 1902
Notes relating to Michigan history
Photographs, 1880s-1900s

note.p: (Informal portraits of De La Vergne; views of Harbor Springs, ca. 1880s; photo, 1900s of individuals in an Overland Car parked on a Harbor Springs street; and photo of logging rollway, Langston, Michigan.)
